evidence: Scaling in time causes the opposite effect in frequency.
The Fourier transform of f of a t becomes one divided by a, times F of s divided by a.
If we stretch the function in time - that is, make it slower - its frequency content gets compressed.
Scaling in time causes the opposite effect in frequency. That’s the scaling property.

concepts.term: time and frequency are tightly connected in the Fourier world
